column1: b'one gets moksha with a visit to the saptapuris'
b'pilgrimage is of utmost importance in hinduism'
b'although all the pilgrimages are major and important there is a great importance and acceptance of the seven places'
b'all of these seven religious places are described as the seven places or saptpuris in the scriptures'
b'it has been stated that a view of the saptapuris in the chaturmas is worth providing moksha for'
b'its name is banaras or varanasi also'
b'this is a famous abode of lord shiva'
b'7 miles away from the mughal sarai station on the main railway line going from mughal sarai to amritsar and dehradun there is kashi and 4 miles ahead from it there is banaras cantonment station'

b'ganges the purgator of the fallen enters the plains leaving mountainous areas in haridwar'

b'garhmukteshwar is a sacred pilgrimage of the hindus'
b'let us go to the ganges fair of garh mukteshwar'

b'the history of north india s famous and ancient religious fair held every year on the occasion of kartik poornima on the banks of the fallen purgator ganges in the garh mukteshwar of ghaziabad district'
b'there is full fervor of the fair this time also in garh mukteshwar and huge crowd of devotees is gathering for the holy dip'
b'the holy dip is on 13 november'

b'it is said about garh mukteshwar that on looking at the detriments of the war and genocide after the disastrous war of the mahabharata yogiraj krishna dharmaraja yudhisthir and arjun regretted hugely'
b'they began thinking as to what should be done for the peace of the innumerable relatives colleagues and innocent people killed in the war'
b'then all decided unanimously'

b'all the sanskars will get completed with worship of the mukteshwar mahadev at a place called shiv ballabhapur established by lord parashuram in khandavi forest t nn cc dt nn in dt jj nn nnp cc vbg dt nn rb'
b'it is to be noted that it is shiv ballabhpur that is known as garh mukteshwar now'
b'maharaj shivi the ancestor of lord rama had spent his exile at garh muktesher'
b'maharaj shivi had lord parashuram establish the shiva temple here'
b'at that time garh mukteshwar was the main center of ballabh sect'
b'garh mukteshwar was named as shiv ballabhpur'
b'the description of garh mukteshwar is found in the shiva purana'
b'a yajna was conducted from the eleventh day to the fourteenth day of the fortnight in garh mukteshwar for the peace of the souls killed in the war of the mahabharata'
b'on the evening of the fourteenth day after the end of the yajna tributes were offered to those souls by offering earthen lamps in the ganges'
b'next day on the full moon morning having bathed in the ganges all offered prayers and religious stories'
b'every year devotees in lacs of numbers come to garh mukteshwar to take a bath in the blemish nn purgator ganges and to offer earthen lamps for the peace of the souls of their kins'
b'innumerous people offer earthen lamps in the ganges as tribute to their kins on the evening of the fourteenth day of the fortnight'
b'during that time lamps flowing with the stream of the ganges appear very peace giving and charming'
b'there are several places of religious importance in garh mukteshwar such as nahush well the temple of the mukteshwar mahadev the badrinath templeh'
b'custom is that the badrinath temple is opened during the prayer time only'
b'this temple is opened only once in a year for the whole day during the birth anniversary of parashuram on akshaya tritiya'
b'there is a sand filled field in front of the mukteshwar mahadev temple which is known as meerabai ki reti'
b'it is believed that meerabai had come to bathe here once'
b'it is said that once parvatiji asked a question to shankarji'
b'lord advise a solution and place by which a living being gets relieved from several ills and sins'
b'what should they do so that they get your affection'

b'on this shankarji said that o devi all the pilgrimages give the fruits of meritorious actions in the satayuga treta in pushkar in dwapar kurukshetra pilgrimage gives the fruits of meritorious actions and in kalikala achievements of the fruits of meritorious actions is only through the ganga bath'
b'there is a place called shiva ballabhpur on the banks of the ganges'
b'shiva resides in the place called shiva ballabhpur'
b'shiva ballabhpur is very favorite to shivaji'
b'shiva ballabhpur is located in the east direction of hastinapur in the country of aryavarta of jambudweep'
b'situated on the banks of the ganges shiva ballabhpur is satisfying to the deities sages and ancestors'
b'shiva ballabhpur area is favorite to me like kashi'
b'the ganges temple in garh mukteshwar is built at a very great height'
b'besides the mother ganges temple there is also a statue of brahmaji installed in garh mukteshwar'
b'there is also such a stone in the ganges temple of garh mukteshwar looking closely at which the shape of lord shiva appears to be on it'
b'at one time there used to be 101 steps to reach the ganga temple of garh mukteshwar'
b'but now there are only 86 steps left in the ganges temple of garh mukteshwar'
b'it is said that till 1937 the ganges used to flow touching the steps of the ganges temple of garh mukteshwar'
b'but gradually ganga jj vbd vbg dt nn'
b'now the bank of the ganges is about 10 kilometres away from this temple'
b'a fair is organized on the sandy fields of the banks of the ganges'
b'one whole city of tents gets settled on the banks during the fair'
b'the venue of the fair is about 90 kilometres from delhi'
b'one can easily reach the fair ground through car etcetera'
b'earlier people had to go on foot to the fair venue in garh mukteshwar'
b'but now there are several ways of travel available'
b'many people reach the fair venue by buggi tractor trollies cars and other resources'
b'it is estimated that every year about twenty lac people come to garh mukteshwar for holy bath in the ganges during the fair in garh mukteshwar'
b'most of the devotees coming to participate in the fair stay in the tents only'
b'apart from the fair people coming during the general days stay in the dharamashalas built around the braj ghat'
b'as such food items are found in several shops here'
b'but devotees coming in the form of groups manage their food etcetera themselves'
b'the fair organized on the eve of kartik poornima on the banks of the ganges in garh mukteshwar is one of the biggest fairs'
b'fair takes place on the banks of the ganges in an area of about 11 kilometres'
b'this time the organization of fair is being done by dividing the fair venue into 20 sectors'
b'for security reasons more police forces have been deployed in garh mukteshwar than earlier'
b'close circuit tvs have also been installed at main places'
b'several ghats have also been built for the bath in the ganges'
b'hastinapur has a historical importance'
b'jain community has special importance for all castes of north india'
b'to go to hastinapur we considered it convenient go from the kashmiri gate bus terminus in delhi'
b'buses go continuously for meerut from kashmere gate'
b'then buses are found from meerut to hastinapur'
b'the distance from delhi to hastinapur is about 105 kilometres'
b'hastinapur is also known by several other names in the scriptures such as gajpur nagpur asandhivat brahmasthal shantinagar kujarpur etc'
b'in hastinapur shree adinath prabhu the first among the twenty four tirthankaras of jainism had ended his four hundred day fast by having juice of sugar cane from shreyansh kumar s hand'
b'it was in hastinapur that twelve kalyanaks of shree shantinath prabhu kunthanath prabhu and shri arahanath prabhu occurred'
b'samosaran of bhagwan malliknath also took place in hastinapur'
b'it was in hastinapur that muni suvrat nath swami bhagwan parswanath and bhagwan mahavir swami preached in their divine voice'
b'the time of ablution and prayer in hastinapur is from 8 o rb in dt nn to cd clock in the evening'
b'and the time to pray in digambar jain temple begins from seven o rb in dt nn'
b'adinath bhagwan came to hastinapur four hundred days after initiation on the third light half month of baisakh'
b'people from afar used to go to visit him'
b'when the prince shreyanshkumar came to know of this he remembered the tradition of his ancestors to abandon food and water'
b'prince shreyanshkumar urged adinatha prabhu to accept sugar cane juice for ending the fast which he accepted'
b'since then this day has started to be called as akshay tritiya'
b'in hastinapur bhagwan made 6 big kings follower of the jain religion with his preachings'
b'out of the 24 tirthankaras the 20th tirthankar shri sant suvrat swami 23rd tirthankar parsvanath bhagwan and the last tirthankar mahavir swami purified this place with their holy feet'
b'there have been a total of 12 supreme emperors in india'
b'the birth place of 6 among the total of 12 supreme emperors of india is hastinapur'
b'parashuram of the ramayana age was also born in hastinapur'
b'hastinapur has been the capital of the kauravas and the pandavas'
b'functions are organized on kartik full moonlight and third lighted fortnight of vaisakh in shwetambar jain temple and between kartik shukla to full moonlight in digambar jain temple'
b'bhagwan adinath had entrusted the states of podanpur and hastinapur to his son bahubali'
b'bahubali ruled podanpur'
b'while his son ruled hastinapur'
b'the younger brother of bahubali shreyansh kumar had performed the feet worship of adinath bhagwan'
b'ratna stambha was built in the memory of shreyansh kumar'
b'the charanpaduka of adinath bhagwan was also installed there'
b'three pillars were also built in the memory of the four kalyanakas of shri shantinatha shri kunthanatha and arahanath bhagawana'
b'king shivraj adopted jainism after listening to the preachings of mahavir swami king shivraj built a pillar in hastinapur in the memory of mahavir swami'
b'a descendant of the emperor ashoka also got many jain temples made during his regime'
b'but with time those ancient pillars and temples have vanished'
b'this hastinapur nagar is present on the banks of the ganges'
b'management of dharamshala is also found for the stay of the people reaching hastinapur'
b'in shwetambar trust dharamshala there are 400 rooms to stay with morning breakfast afternoon lunch and dinner at night'
b'there are several other dharamashalas found easily in the same fashion'
b'atishay kshetra tijarah one gets more than desired here'
b'chandra prabhu digamber jain atishay kshetra dehra nnp vbz vbn in dt nnp nn in nnp'
b'this is called atishay area'
b'the meaning of atishay is more than common'
b'that is such an area where something extraordinary occurs or some miracle happens'
b'that is if something is demanded in general one gets more than that'
b'you get so much that you get overwhelmed'
b'such is the belief of tijara area'
b'this atishay area of tijara let s say temple is situated at a distance of 52 kilometres from alvar district and 117 kilometers from delhi'
b'the 8th tirthankar of the 24 tirthankaras shree chandra prabhu bhagawan is worshipped in tijara atishay kshetra'
b'the extremely beautiful white statue of chandra prabhu bhagawan is installed in tijara atishay kshetra'
b'this marble statue had come out during the excavation conducted in this area on 16 august 1956'
b'it is said that saraswati devi the wife of a famous doctor bihari lal of tijara area had kept fast for three days'
b'on the third day of the night of fast saraswati devi saw something unprecedented about a place near her house in dream'
b'next morning when that place was dug the grand statue of chandra prabhu bhagawan was found'
b'when the statue was taken out after the excavation devotees meant this by it'
b'having full joy of the nature in train while going to goa has a different fun'
b'nature itself welcomed the statue with water and purified it'
b'several years after this incident another black color statue of chandra prabhu bhagawan in padmasan posture was found from the same place on 29 march 1972'
b'this statue of chandra prabhu bhagawan had come out during the excavations of southern gate'
b'installed in the atishay kshetra the outer structure of this temple is extremely grand'
b'installed in the atishay kshetra the internal decoration of this temple is very alluring'
b'there is so much space in the courtyard of the temple that two thousand people can easily stay present here at a time'
b'the train route going to goa is full of small hills and valleys'
b'there is a big hall in the tijara'
b'lead work has been done on both the sides of the tijara hall'
b'ancient stories have been depicted through the medium of pictures on the walls of the hall in tijara'
b'in the temple of the atishay kshetra a person prays with true heart before this statue'
b'it is believed that all the desires of a person is fulfilled'
b'people affected with witchcraft also come to tijara to get rid of their problems'
b'an extremely attractive pillar is installed in front of the temple'
b'this is called by the name of man nnp'
b'statues of deities have been installed on the top of the pillar'
b'the statues of the deities are visible from afar'
b'this is called man stambh'
b'the pride of a person lessens with mere a view of the man stambh'
b'general custom is that four statues of tirthankar bhagawan is installed on the top of the man stambh'
b'special programs are organized twice a year in tijara'
b'once on the seventh day of falgun and the second time on the tenth day of shravan shukla'
b'dharmashala with 300 rooms has been built in atishay kshetra of tijara for the lodging of devotees'
b'tijara was famous with the name of atishay kshetra dehra in ancient times'
b'with the change of time this place came to be known as dehra tijara and now only tijara'
b'kanker valley national park is situated 35 kilometres south from the district headquarters of bastar'
b'kanker valley national park is famous for its waterfalls caves and bio nn'
b'the main tourist places of kanker valley are as follows'
b'the hypnotic waterfall of tirathgarh located at distance of 35 kilometres from jagdalpur hypnotises the minds of the tourists'
b'tourists lose themselves in its charming beauty'
b'one does not feel like going away from tirathgarh'
b'situated on the munagabahar river this waterfall falls 300 feet down from the moon shaped hill on the ladder like natural structures'
b'the milky foam formed with the fall of water and the natural fountain of drops of water wetten the tourists gradually'
b'having an m tech in geology i tried to know its geological genesis'
b'i found this'
b'crores of years ago the rocks of the down side river formed of moon nns jj to dt nn vbd rb'
b'and this ladder like valley would have created this charming waterfall'
b'a temple of archaeological importance is located 20 kilometres away from tirathgarh waterfall in chingitarai'
b'along with tirathgarh chingitarai and chandragiri have historical importance'
b'it is said'
b'there were two sons of a king of tirathgarh estate'
b'one was prince chandradeva and the other tirathdev'
b'prince chandradeva got the area of chandragiri in inheritance'
b'it was chandradeva after the name of whom this was named as chandragiri'
b'whereas his brother got the estate of tirathgarh'
b'whose name came to be tirathgarh after his name'
b'ruins of archaeological importance are found in chandragiri and chingitarai'
b'natural caves of world acclaimed kotamsar are located at a distance of 30 kilometres from jagdalpur'
b'the length of this longest cave of the world is 4500 metres'
b'formed out of the dissolution of lime stones these caves are famous for the structures made from the condensation of lime stone'
b'due to the condensation of lime stone structures like stalactite stalagmite and dripstones are formed'
b'the jingle bell hanging from the roof pillar are called stalagtite those going up from the ground stalagmite and large pillars adjoining the roof and the ground are called dripstones'
b'dr shankar tiwari had described this cave for the first time'
b'there are small ponds located in this cave'
b'the small fish found in the caves do not have eyes'
b'the utility of their eyes finished due to staying in the dark for centuries'
b'now these fish are blind by birth itself'
b'this validates the principles of darwin'
b'kailash caves are situated at a distance of 16 kilometres from kotamsar'
b'its big halls give the appearance of court of a king'
b'the shapes of lime stone look like shivlingas'
b'therefore these caves also have religious importance'
b'there is a queue of devotees on the day of mahashivaratri in the kailash cave'
b'kailash cave is at a height of 50 metre and is 2500 metres long'
b'dandak cave is at a distance of 8 kilometres from kotamsar'
b'like kotamasar cave the structures like stalactite stalagmite and dripstones in dandak cave give a grand look'
b'in the aranyak caves attached to the kanger valley the stalagmite structures of jadhara jhanpi and makar kaksha is spectacular'
b'the enormous hills of the kanker appear eager to welcome the bastar district while coming from raipur to jagdalpur'

b'daman and diu are also among the national territories of india'
b'unfathomable waters of the arabian sea have made them main centres of trade and tourism'

b'after that having become independent of the portuguese daman and diu were merged with goa'

b'the distance of daman from mumabi the main trade center of india is about 193 kilometres'

b'amritsar is a historical city'

b'kumbha festival cycle is as follows'
b'the kumbh festivals of all the four places have been related with the astrological calculation and the main dates of bathing'

b'according to the second opinion the auspicious time of kumbh does not occur until the astrological conjunction does not form'
b'if the equation of the other planets do not agree then the kumbh festival can take place in the eleventh and the thirteenth year also'

b'saturn is the boss'
b'saturn is the air element'
b'water and air this is the environment'
b'sun earth fire elements obviously have importance'
b'the kumbh of haridwar is symbolic of this very sun sign'
b'one day of gods is equivalent to the one year of the humans'
b'this is the reason why according to the serial order of the position of the planets kumbh festival is celebrated at four places in the twelfth year'
b'this festival itself is the synonym of the fair'

b'during low tide sea creatures can be seen in pirotan islands'
b'located at a distance of 30 kilometres from the jamnagar of gujarat there is a group of 42 such islands which are shelter of different types birds of national and foreign origin'
b'rich with mangrove the pirotan island is ideal not only for these birds but are source of several types of sea creatures as well'
b'watching the sea creatures in their natural habitat in pirotan island is a unique experience'
b'to conserve these very different colors of life in water the government of india declared these islands conserved area in 1980'
b'after two years these islands got the pride of becoming first national marine park of the country'
b'there is an abundance of mangroves on the marshy surface of the pirotan islands'
b'the roots of mangrove are situated at some height from the surface so that they can receive the necessary amount of oxygen from air'
b'several small aquatic creatures are generated in the roots of the mangroves'
b'the leaves of mangroves are the food of several small creatures living in water'
b'even birds flying in the heights of sky depend on these very mangroves for their food'
b'this is the reason that these grasslands situated in the sea are called the source of life also'

b'to be the view of this extraordinary world of the sea life one has to get the permission from the office of national marine park located in jamnagar then starts a journey which reveals several mysteries of sea life'
b'just as we reached the bedi port our sights fell on a big group of birds and dolphins hopping on the surface of water also was seen'
b'we started our travel from the bedi port'
b'just as we reached the port our eyes fell on a large group of birds which became invisible from eyes touching the shore in seconds'
b'we had not yet covered even a few minutes of our journey as luck gave us company and we saw dolphins hopping on the surface of water'
b'seeing these dolphins playing in water it was appearing as if they were welcoming our arrival to this island'
b'as we were reaching near the island mangrove forest and bevy of different kinds of birds sitting on its branches were getting clearer to our eyes'
b'preying birds like hover and marsh herrier were flying at some height above the level of water with their focussed eyes and sharp claws'
b'as soon as it saw a prey it pounced with the electrical agility on them and got hold of them in its sharp claws'
b'here we also got to see a bevy of rare birds like pallas s fish also'
b'from far off the light house of pirotan island was visible to us'
b'in about two hours we covered this journey filled with adventure'
b'wearing a cover of the golden sand on the shores of this island innummerable crabs crawling on the ground will come to your sight'
b'to see and undersatand the natural diversity of pirotan island it is imperative to have a guide'
b'the nearest airport of pirotan island is at a distance of seven kilometers in jamnagar'
b'the nearest railway station of pirotan island is jamnagar and rajkot at a distance of 90 kms'
b'the best time for going to pirotan is between october to april'
b'as if a standstill came in the surface of the sea that is the situation of low tide was created'
b'with the guide of the forest department sheelu bhai we went out to see the unique scene of life in water'
b'here in the clean water we got to see so many ranges of rocks of coral'
b'seeing these rocks it was appearing as if it was a treasure of preciuos stones'
b'in reality these dazziling ranges of rocks play the role of security shield to micro nn in dt vbg nn in nn cc dt nn in nn dt nn vb rbr jj cc jj'
b'the first sea creature on which our sights fell was octopus'
b'perhaps it had got a feeling of the fact that we had seen it and like a lizard it adapted itself in the color of the stone'
b'for the first time we were seeing any sea creature so closely'
b'on the surface of its body there were several small pores'
b'through which it tightens its prey strongly in its hold'
b'the speciality of this illusory creature is that it can adapt itself into different color according to the environment'
b'as soon as sheelu bhai freed it it emitted liquid substance of black color into water and disappeared like smoke'
b'there are many such creatures in the sea that use their unique abilities either to hunt or to protect themselves from getting hunted'
b'star fish can separate its arms from its body as soon as it comes in the clutches of the hunter'
b'fish named puffer can even enlagre its body three times bigger that its real size'
b'seeing it any one can get hallucinated that it is a powerful big fish'
b'it was a thrilling view to see different races of crabs present here'
b'apart from blue neptune red coral the upper part of the body of some was covered with thorny hair which sheelu bhai gave the name of wolf crab'
b'just in a while our meeting with star fish and puffer fish also occurred'
b'as soon as sheelu bhai picked up the puffer fish in his hands it bloated like a balloon'
b'it is really a workable mechanism for protection'

b'for finding out about missing persons also contact with announcement centres situated at katra ban ganga adhakuwari and darbaar of shri mata vaishno devi shrine board'

b'while giving donations at various places in predetermined donation centres lrb central office nn nn nn rrb jj jj nn cc in jj nns in dt nn vb dt nn'
b'please remember that all development work and traveller convenience program are run by the donations given by you only'
b'do not tire yourself much in climbing and expecting stairs go by the concrete path only and follow only main roads short cuts can prove to be fatal'
b'do not leave your things near unknown people or abandoned on bathing embankments'
b'during the journey remain cautious of suspicious people'
b'for keeping the purity of the place preserved do not gamble and play cards etc do not smoke and do not eat betel'
b'please do not make pictures at places do not put posters and do not disfigure aanouncement boards and also do not throw garbage at any place'

b'the establishment of sri mata vaishno devi shrine board was done in 1986 by the state governor of jammu and kashmir by enacting a directive after which in 1988 confirmation was done by the legislative assembly of the state'
b'for making conveniences and services available to the state the shrine board has done development work on a large scale'
b'as a result of the attempts of the shrine board the following work happened'
b'a road of path of 13 km was made again it was made broad and tiles were spread on it'
b'alongside arrangements were made of light from 650 powerful sodium vapor lamps on the whole path'
b'parapets were made on five thousand places in the path and a 3000 meter long railing was fixed'
b'at the building and in the path 650 toilets with automatic water cleaning have been made'
b'besides this arrangements have been made of separate places for bathing of women and men'
b'for the administration of all these conveniences 400 workers have been appointed'

b'for making arrangements of higher level cleaning appliances pulling garbage with air lrb absorbent rrb smoke emitting aplliances and for making clean blankets available to passengers arrangements have been made for automatic clothes washing appliances'
b'apart from one primary treatment center five treatment units and one evening treatment center are also run'
b'in the path a shady shelter place and 13 shelter and meal houses have been constructed'
b'there are arrangements for clean and vegetarian meals at places selling food items'
b'at each place the price list is displayed conspicuously'
b'in the path arrangements have been made of water for drinking at places and appliances have been fixed for cold water'
b'for arrangement of additional place for dwelling construction work is going on a large scale'
b'the work of forest plantation has been started on a large scale and at 70 places construction of parks flower gardens and bowers has been done'
b'for the entertainment of passengers waiting for view arrangements have been made of the screening of religious films'

b'besides this the shrine board has also started the work of public service and eight school wings and two work centres have been made whose aim is to provide professionalism to the women of that area and and procure work'
b'through the board even such people are given help who provide various kinds of services for the comfort of passengers'
b'for awakening an interest towards the study of indian culture eight scholarships are also given by the board'
b'whatever development work is happening in this area from that the residents of this area and travellers both are profiting'
b'the bus stand of katra has been expanded market and park have been made consequential of which this area has begun looking more prosperous'
b'consequential to adopting scientific methods of correct improvements and provisions the journey there has become comfortable along with being a medium of spiritual upliftment'

b'in the improvements done by the shrine board construction of shelter places and clean kitchens provision of comfort of food and establishment of automatic machines for washing of clothes are included'
b'tsomoriri lake t nn in dt jj nn in dt nn'

b'at a distance of 240 kilometer from leh included in the protected area situated in the midst of extensive mountain ranges and the roost of diversified birds at one end of the world the beauty of tsomoriri lake is unique'
b'i am talking of the tsomoriri lake which is probably situated at one end of the world'
b'the calm deep blue color of the water of tsomoriri lake makes this appear as if a piece of blue sky has come falling on the earth'
b'situated at a height of approximately 15000 feet from the earth the tsomoriri lake is 23 kilometer long and from eight to ten kilometer wide'
b'the mountains on four sides of tsomoriri lake are always covered with snow'
b'situated in the rupshu valley of ladakh the extremely beautiful tsomoriri lake is the breeding place for many kinds of birds'
b'from june till september months specific kinds of swans high crested birds and brahmani ducks can be seen swimming in large numbers'
b'the sweet water of tsomoriri lake is an invaluable gift of many migratory birds'
b'after crossing a distance of 250 kilometers from leh we had reached tsomoriri in the month of september'
b'in ladakhi language the meaning of tso is lake'
b'for coming till tsomoriri lake we had to cross leh upsi chumathang mahe and piga'
b'in the middle falls nam sangla valley whose height is approximztely 15 cd nns'
b'approximately 10 kilometers ahead from here is a small canal on crossing the bridge constructed on which moriri lake begins'
b'outside strong freezing winds are blowing'
b'it is not possible to stand till much time in the strong freezing winds and be able to take the pleasure of the beauty of the lake'
b'according to dorjee lrb driver rrb we were going to karzok the village at the border'
b'for going to karzok the road runs along the edge of the lake'
b'after going five kilometers ahead from the road at the edge of the lake karzok village comes'
b'karzok village is the permanent residence place of an aborigines changpa'
b'sustaining the bad weather of karzok the changpa people do farming of barley here'
b'it is believed that farming of barley in the highest area of the world is done in karzok'
b'changpa rear yak sheep and goat and live all year in tents made of the black colored fur of the yak'
b'pashmina goats are valuable assets of the changpa people'
b'in days of winter thick hair grows on pashmina goats'
b'in days of summer the changpa people make an accumulation of the hair shed by the pashmina goats'
b'the hair shed by the pashmina goats is called pashm'
b'the famous pashmina shawls of kasmir are made from pashm only'
b'we had become tired by continuously doing mountain trekking for six hours'
b'we were also feeling very hungry'
b'on reaching karzok having eaten hot khichdi at a small restaurant made in a parachute tent the hunger subsided'
b'when we stretched our arms and legs sometime in the warmth of the bed laid in the tent then we felt alive and the desire to do something awakened'
b'we went to see the only gompa lrb budhha temple rrb of the village situated in the vicinity'
b'the entrance door of the main temple of the gompa lrb budhha temple rrb is very colorful and pictorial'
b'having climbed the roof of the inclusion room of the gompa saw tsomoriri ourselves'
b'the heart lifted up on having seen a fascinating flock of birds of tsomoriri with binoculars'
b'from the roof of the gompa tried to see the tents of the changpa aborigines but could not see'
b'maybe on going more ahead from here viewing would have happened'
b'the map of karzok is changing with the new buildings constructed of concrete according to the usage of the cities'
b'its obvious that in this way there can be infiltration unknowingly in the natural beauty and tradition of the village'
b'seeing this from the roof of gompa wished that if there remained fixed a traditional culture here instead of modern culture then such a unique view would have been seen'
b'tsomoriri situated in rupshu valley is a cultural area'
b'therefore for entering in tsomoriri travellers require a permission letter'
b'on requesting this permission letter can be obtained free from the deputy collector office situated near of the polo ground of leh'
b'the permission letter is obained for minimum four persons and maximum for one week'
b'travellers are given advice that make many photo copies of the permission letter because this is asked at many check posts'

b'the way of water consumption compensates less oxygen in the environment'

b'the symbol of supreme knowledge mahabodhi temple is completely different from other temples of north india because of its architecture'

b'the four vertex at are built on all the four sides of the temple to give balance to the whole structure'
b'there is a gold laden idol of buddha established in the sanctorum of the temple'
b'the railing made up of stone decorated with beautiful figures carved on it is the most ancient heritage of bodhgaya in the premises of the temple'
b'the bodhi tree is the descendant of that pure tree under which prince siddhartha had achieved enlightenment by penance'
b'according to the specialists the present tree is the fourth or fifth scion of the original tree'
b'there is a great demand for the saplings of bodhi tree across the world'
b'there are the remnants of the original railing made up of sand stone and granite stone around all the four sides of the mahabodhi temple'
b'on these beautiful idols figures have been carved'

b'it is said that buddha had sat under the bodhi tree at this very place'
b'it is described in the chakraman buddhist literature that buddha had continued to walk here and there and speculate under the tree itself for seven days after the enlightenment'
b'the duration of his walking was considered very auspicious and in the ancient time lrb probably first century after christ rrb a memorial was built in that duration itself'

b'during deepavali in gujarat the preparation for it starts even 15 days before'
b'at first the bazaars get crowded'

b'on the coming of diwali women get busy with the items for the decoration of houses and engage in the sanitation of the house 15 days ago'
b'after that they prepare all the sweets with their own hands and prepare different sorts of snacks'
b'there you are dial has started'
b'if vagh baras has come then festivals have started'
b'yes in gujarat the start of burning the diyas start since the day of vagh baras itself'
b'diyas are lighted in front of the houses of everybody'
b'festival start from this day till next ten days'
b'on that day clearing their old accounts businessmen start new ones'
b'after that comes dhanteras'
b'on the day of dhanteras laxmipujan takes place in the houses of everybody and fifty six items are offered to the mother'
b'all the people of the home gather and worship mother laxmi'
b'the grace of mother laxmi be always with them that is what they wish'
b'after that comes chaudas'
b'on the day of kali chaudas fried items of oil is prepared mandatorily in every house in gujarat'
b'which is called kalah'
b'it is said that by doing so evil air goes out of home and peace is established'
b'on this day at several places tantric methods also take place by the tantrics'
b'then comes deepawali which every human being waits for very impatiently'
b'bazaar is decorated like a bride on the day of deepawali'
b'special deepavali pujan is held in large companies'
b'in deepavali even night glitters like the day'
b'in deepavali everybody starting from the children to the elders are seen cracking the crackers'
b'on the day of deepavali there is rangoli in everybody s courtyard'
b'in deepavali the whole of the house is seen glittering with the light of diyas'
b'several types of sweets are eaten on deepavali'
b'now on the next day comes the new year of the gujaratis'
b'everybody gets ready getting up early in the morning'
b'wearing new clothes go to temple to have the blessings of god'
b'after that they take the blessings of the elders and then go everybody s homes to meet their relatives and give congratulations for the new year and sweeten each other s mouth with sweets'
b'in the whole of gujarat from the new year till the fifth all the shops of the market are closed'

b'this custom of congratulating each other keep on for about 15 days'
b'at this time the whole of gujarat gets colored in a different color'

b'there are several temples of suryaputra shanidev in the country'

b'the speciality of the this world famous shani temple is that the stone statue of shanidev located here is auspiciously present on a platform of a marble under the open sky without any umbrella or dome'
b'located in this miraculous shani temple of shinganapur the statue of shanidev is about five feet nine inches high and about one feet six inches wide'
b'faithfuls from in and out of the country come here and get the advantage of visiting this rare statue of shanidev'
b'in the temple here women are restricted to go near the shani statue'
b'women view shanidev from distance'
b'be it morning or evening winter or summer for the men to go near the shani statue located here it is extremely mandatory to wear yellow dhoti after bathing'
b'without doing this men can not touch shani statue'
b'for this better facilities are available for bathing and clothes in shinganapur'
b'several taps are attached with a tank in the open ground bathing in the water of which men can get the benefits of having the darshan of shanidev'
b'for the goods of worshipping etc also there are several shops nearby taking the prayer goods from where you can offer to shanidev'

b'shanidev is auspicious'

b'upon whosoever shani bestows his grace all the gates of success opens for that person'
b'the speciality of shinganapur is non occurrence of thieving here'
b'you will be surprised to know that in most of the houses of shinganapur there are no windows doors and lockers'

b'this is because stealing does not happen here'

b'in different districts of rajashthan the carrier of glorious cultural traditions the fervor of festivals and functions keep on throughout the year'

b'in the industrial city bhilwara of this region organized in combined coordination of the district administration and common people the start and style of the annual bhilwara mahotsav is different from all'

b'having a different identity of its own with the point of view of the textile industry not only in rajasthan but also in the country and the world the bhilwara mahotsav in the district of bhilwara is celebrated every year in the month of december january with the goal of encouraging tourism'

b'the multicolor mascot of the bhilwara mahotsav is also very attractive'
b'the pictures are made in traditional style of rajasthan'
b'in this mascot with the royal look two actors riding an elephant have been shown greeting'
b'in the center the symbol of the textile industry lrb angle of seven colored thread rrb has been shown'
b'the start of the three day bhilwara mahotsav occurs with a magnificent pageant coming in the morning period of the first day'
b'each day of the three day bhilwara mahotsav comes with several colors'
b'besides traditional folk dance and songs colors of games and entertainment are also included'
b'the ambience is like that of fair in the festival'
b'several performers show their performances here'
b'at the same time several competitions are also held for men and women of different age groups'
b'for the cultural programs being organized during bhilwara mahotsav muktakashi stage is prepared in the chitrakoot dhaam complex'

b'its end occurs with colorful fireworks'
b'on the second day of the bhilwara mahotsav competition of making tasty cuisines pooja dish decoration competition and mandana competition are held'
b'the games that people enjoy the most are the matki race mataki phod and rassakasi competition'
b'with the fall of evening stir in the main strolling ground nehru park gets faster'
b'the decoration of nehru park is attractive'
b'under deepotsav the view of deepdan done in the nehru talai here is spectacular'
b'gathering in groups young women in traditional clothes do deepdan in the lake and celebrate deepotsav'
b'on the closing day of the bhilwara mahotsav an ambience of fun keeps on in the policeline maidan'
b'among the best of the functions are included the hockey match kite flying bullock cart race and horse race competitions'
b'in the range of the night time cultural programs every night programs presented in new and attractive style fully entertain the audience'
b'in the environment of fervor happiness and excitement this festival is celebrated'
b'bhilwara mahotsav has really become a memorable function'
b'every year people wait for the bhilwara mahotsav eagerly'
b'during the function in bhilwara your vacation will really pass with fun'
b'along with enjoying this function you will also be able to have the views of several visiting places in this 400 years old city'

b'after a journey of about six hours having reached bethari we found that the climate there was full of humidity totally contradictory to our thinking'
b'therefore we took out towards kalpetta which was 25 kilometres farther from here'

b'we also enjoyed boating in the pukut lake'

b'after pukut lake we went to the banasur dam'
b'everybody should go to banasura dam because this is the biggest dam of asia'
b'the reservoir of the banasura dam and some parts drowned in the hills tell their stories themselves'
b'the specialty of rains here is that it can drench us any time with drizzling water and that is how it happened'
b'in the month of april while returning the drops of drizzle drenched us'
b'in the situation full or rains views were also not visble clearly'
b'the food here is comparatively cheaper than bengalooru'

b'the beauty of the buds of tea in the golden light of the sun was looking amazing'
b'we felt that we will spend all the time here so made off quickly towards the suchipara waterfalls'
b'suchipara waterfalls falls from a height of 100 feet to 300 feet'

b'the birth of the twenty fourth and the last tirthankar vardhman mahavir took place in sixth century before christ in a suburb or vaishali in the house of king siddharth jnatrika dynasty'
b'vardhman mahavir was the follower of twenty third thirthankar parshva'
b'mahavir s mother trishala was the sister of the king of vaishali and her relation was with the lichhavi family the administrator of videh'
b'when mahavir was of thirty years then his parents died'
b'it is believed that his parents sacrificed the body by fasting'
b'after that the elder brother of mahavir nandivardhan took the reigns and mahavir became an ascetic breaking relation with the mundane pleasures and bonds'
b'on the day of leaving home he was taken to the ashoka tree through a palanquin'
b'there he sacrificed the royal robes and jewelleries'
b'since then he did penance for 13 years i ym in dt nn in cd nns'

b'in the last stage of the period when he was in trance in deep meditation under the shal tree on the banks of the rijupalika river he achieved the supreme knowledge which was called nirvana or kaivalya'
b'mahavir traveled from north to south of bihar for a long period of 42 years'
b'during this period several people became his followers they were called nigrantha or who broke all the social bonds after the death of mahavir lrb c 490 bc rrb and they were called jains'
b'it is believed that mahavir took his last breath in apapa lrb pava rrb place of bihar while the death twenty three jain tirthankars took place on the famous parasnath hill of the jharkhand state'
b'the name of this hill was given after the twenty third tirthankar parsvanath who achieved the wished death by fast i s vbn nnp'
b'it has been called sammet sikhar in the kalpa sutra while at other places it is called samidagir or mallparvat'
b'samidagiri is a declension of samadhigir because about nineteen tirthankaras achieved moksha on this mountain'

b'it is believed that the last tirthankar of the jain relgion lord mahavir had taken rest during his tour in the bishram stupa of ara therefore in the local language the name of this place came to be bisram'
b'from the corners of the country the followers of jain religion keep coming here througout the year'
b'the statue of lord mahavir is there in the temple here'
b'there are about 45 temples in ara'
b'masar this village is located 9 km in west or say south west from arah'
b'there is a jain temple here which is dedicated to tirthankar parshvanath'
b'there are eight statues here'
b'according to the edicts found here these statues are of the initial period'
b'archaeological evidences say that the construction of this temple was in done in 1819 ad eight statues installed in it are of 1386 ad'
b'every year in the month of shravan annual puja is held here in which thousands of followers come here and pray'
